name: Senior Java Developer (Global Booking and Allocations)
description:
About the project

GBA (Global Booking and Allocations) is a strategic BNP Paribas middle office platform offering the Trade Capture function for multiple asset classes of financial products. It consumes front office data for straight through trade processing using wide range of booking models. GBA provides booking and allocations services for all spectrum of asset classes (stocks, options, ETFs, indexes, etc) and products (cash, swap, etc) used in Equity Trading, Prime Brokerage and Equity Derivatives business lines.

The IT team developing the GBA platform is geographically spread over Moscow, London, New York and Hong Kong. Moscow is one of major development centers holding key technical expertise and counting up to 20+ specialists (permanent and contracted)

The successful candidate will join the globally distributed team of 12+ software engineers. He / she will participate in all stages of development lifecycle from requirements analysis and solution design to successful implementation of the product, roll out to end users and level 3 support.

Stack: Java SE 8, Spring, Solace, Oracle, .NET WPF

Requirements:

  • Solid experience of professional development in Java in Financial/Capital Markets Sector
  • Understanding of programming patterns in Financial/Capital Markets Sector
  • Experience in working with high frequency/low latency data processing systems
  • Experience with high volume data processing systems
  • Understanding algorithm complexity
  • Plus: Hands-on experience with messaging platforms (Solace, MQ)
  • Plus: Hands-on experience with Unix/Linux
  • Plus: Understanding Equity trading workflows
  • Plus: Agile/XP development experience including test driven development
